Application of CAPTCHA is activated.
No CAPTCHA is used.
Words are filtered.
Words are not filtered.
All users will be checked.

Preventing users from sending form data multiple times.
The input is not checked.
This option enables you to choose individual settings.

This menu enables you to choose, if and by which filters the input, the visitor sends to the server, is automatically checked. This aims at the avoidance of unrequested ads and vandalism. If the user's input is suspicious, the process will automatically be aborted. A message will be generated for the visitor, to describe the error and an entry will be added to the system's logs, for you to review.

This menu lets you choose a level of protection. These are meant to ease the configuration for you. Each level provides you with predefined settings. If you are not satisfied with these, you may choose the menu's option "user defined", to choose individual settings for all sections.
A "CAPTCHA" is an image, that shows numbers and letters, the user must type in a form field. While a human can read the image, most automated programs (bots) are not able to do this.
If you choose "yes", input will always be checked. If you choose "no", only unknown visitors without a login will be checked.
The logs can be found via the administration panel. This option is only available, if the system logs are activated.

Prevents user from accidentally sending form data multiple times. Also a user may submit a form no earlier than 3 seconds after it has been opened. This provides good protection against unrequested ads through automated programs.
Checks the header data send by the browser for signatures of known bots.
Checks input for suspicious words, which may not be present. If any such word is found, the entry will not be added.
Experienced users may increase the efficiency of this filter, by providing words as regular expressions. For regular expressions a perl-compatible syntax is used.
